evidence.source_document: Emergency Motion for a Stay Pending Appeal
evidence.text: On April 12, 2025, Plaintiffs filed their Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, and Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order. See id. at *4. In the TRO motion, Plaintiffs sought emergency relief on the grounds that they believed that they were in "imminent danger of being transferred" outside the judicial district "en route to removal," and sought an injunction prohibiting their transfer and "30-day notice of any intent to remove Plaintiffs and the opportunity to contest an alien enemy designation."

extracted.value: On April 12, 2025, Plaintiffs D.B.U. and R.M.M. filed a Class Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Class Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, along with an Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order. The motion sought to prevent their removal from the District of Colorado and required the government to provide 30-day notice before any removal, including an opportunity to contest an alien enemy designation.

evidence.source_document: Emergency Motion for a Stay Pending Appeal
evidence.text: On April 12, 2025, Plaintiffs also filed, inter alia, a Motion for Class Certification. See id.

extracted.value: On April 12, 2025, Plaintiffs D.B.U. and R.M.M. filed a Motion for Class Certification, seeking to have the court certify a class of individuals they proposed to represent in their habeas corpus action.

evidence.source_document: Emergency Motion for a Stay Pending Appeal
Emergency Motion for a Stay Pending Appeal
evidence.text: EMERGENCY MOTION FOR A STAY PENDING APPEAL

extracted.value: On April 23, 2025, Defendants-Appellants filed an Emergency Motion for a Stay Pending Appeal with the Tenth Circuit Court of Appeals, seeking to stay the District Court's orders that prohibited the transfer of Plaintiffs and imposed a 21-day notice requirement for individuals subject to the Alien Enemies Act Proclamation.
